meanings.definition: To cause a cell membrane potential to become more negative than resting potential.
meanings.sent1: When the medicine hyperpolarizes the cell, it makes the inside more negative.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed how the drug hyperpolarizes the cell membrane.
meanings.sent3: The hyperpolarizing effect of the treatment made the cell feel like it was in a negative mood.
meanings.sent4: The music hyperpolarizes my emotions, making me feel more downbeat.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dark storm cloud hyperpolarizes the atmosphere, creating a sense of gloom.

meanings.definition: To make something more polarized than usual.
meanings.sent1: The special glasses hyperpolarizes the light, making it easier to see details.
meanings.sent2: The filter hyperpolarizes the colors, enhancing the contrast in the photograph.
meanings.sent3: The artist hyperpolarizes the paint colors to create a striking visual effect.
meanings.sent4: The new technology hyperpolarizes the screen, making images appear sharper.
meanings.sent5: The lens hyperpolarizes the sunlight, reducing glare and improving visibility.
